Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos stand; interior glazed black (a 'reserved band' on top is use wear); exterior: lip and collar black, between them reserved zone with black-figure decoration consisting of animal frieze (on left part of rump and tail of possible bull, to left; panther to left, head frontal with added red on neck, chest, dabs on left ear, ribs, flank and dots on shoulder).
Curator's comments: The clay was analysed by M. Hughes and found to be Attic: Harbottle, G., Hughes, M. J. and Seleem, S. 'The Origin of black-figure Greek ceramics found in Naucratis (Nile Delta)', Archaeometry 47, 2005, 511-8; p.513, table 1, no.16 For panther's markings, compare Munich 1681 (ABV, 108, no. 12: early Lydos; Beazley, J. D., The Development of Attic Black-Figure. Berkley 1986, 2nd edition, pl. 40, no. 2).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 481, no. B839)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0266) (Phase 1)
